CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1967, pg. 17, reads: "STRIKING - Two of the most striking outfits modeled at the NULBA Fashion Show at Chatham Center, were designed and created by Alberta Thompson (left). She is wearing a black velvet form - fitting Chinese style ensemble with matching hat trimmed in rhinestones. Long dangling rhinestone earrings completed her attire.  The white brocade coat trimmed in feathers worn by Glora [sic] Grate was also created by the talented and pretty Alberta. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Alberta Thompson modeling black velvet form fitting dress and long rhinestone earrings, and Gloria Golden Grate modeling white brocade coat trimmed in feathers, posed under arch in Chatham Center for NULBA [Tavern Owners] fashion show
CatSubject_tab: Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Grate, Gloria Golden.Fashion models--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Thomas, Alberta.Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
